citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)
citeinfo.title: Oceanographic In-situ Data Access

descript.abstract: Interactive on-line data access to oceanographic in-situ data sets, which allows users to select data based on space, time, and keyword. Selected data can be viewed as user-customizable, on-the-fly plots, listed, or downloaded. Includes NOAA PMEL Pacific Ocean data observations from the tropics to the Arctic, and global data from the NODC World Ocean Database, served through the EPIC Web Browser and through OPeNDAP.
descript.purpose: NOAA/PMEL's EPIC system was designed for management, display and analysis of oceanographic and meteorological in-situ data with gateways to the web, popular analysis tools and the Internet. Web access is available at http://www.epic.noaa.gov/epic/ewb/. Most recently, OPeNDAP (formerly called DODS) access is available for OPeNDAP in-situ data clients at http://www.epic.noaa.gov:10100/dods.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
